text: The 1980 National Convention of the Republican Party of the United States. It was held at the Joe Louis Arena in Detroit, Michigan. It took place from July 14 to July 17, 1980. The 32nd Republican National Convention nominated former Governor Ronald W. Reagan of California for President. It also nominated former congressman George H. W. Bush of Texas for Vice President. ==References== ==Other websites== *Ronald Reagan's nomination acceptance speech Category:20th century in Detroit Category:Republican Party (United States) Category:United States presidential nominating conventions Category:1980 in the United States Category:1980s in Michigan Category:July events
title: 1980 Republican National Convention
